snippet.textDisplay:
Great video! Nothing will change the recommendations you bring up:
1. Wash 🖐 hands 🖐 (20+ seconds! and twice if you want) after coming home, and after touching something from outside your house
2. Don’t touch face 🧑👦
3. Don’t shake hands 🚫🤝
4. Disinfect your cell phone often 🦠📱
5. If you feel fever cough, fatigue, get that checked out by Dr. 👩‍⚕️👨‍⚕️, as you normally would!
#AlertNotAnxious
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: I read from one news article the reason why WHO doesn't want to declare Coronavirus as a pandemic despite the fact that coronavirus has spread to many countries.  If WHO declares it as a pandemic, this will trigger many countries to start their standard response to pandemic - that is using treatment (like using a machine to keep a patient alive) to cope with the situation instead of using containment.  But WHO still think that containment is the right approach for most countries (and I agree with WHO).  And WHO doesn't want countries to give up on using the containment just yet.
snippet.textOriginal: I read from one news article the reason why WHO doesn't want to declare Coronavirus as a pandemic despite the fact that coronavirus has spread to many countries.  If WHO declares it as a pandemic, this will trigger many countries to start their standard response to pandemic - that is using treatment (like using a machine to keep a patient alive) to cope with the situation instead of using containment.  But WHO still think that containment is the right approach for most countries (and I agree with WHO).  And WHO doesn't want countries to give up on using the containment just yet.

snippet.textDisplay: I live in China. I'm a little worried about the UK's lax attitude since my family live there. I remember when China decided to take action and lock everthing down at the end of January. Back then we only had cases in the low hundreds. and despite making it illegal not to wear masks, having almost everything that wasn't a food shop or a chemist close down, telling everyone to stay indoors as much as possible etc... it still spread from that small number to a hundred thousand. Italy waited a long time to take action and now they are in a bad way. Borris Johnson has basically said he wants to wait until summer to do anything because he doesn't want to add too much strain to the NHS. The UK has about a hundred cases and they are still giving people a choice on how they want to react and not closing the schools, non essential buildings etc. From what I've experienced the action they eventually take will last a much longer time the longer they wait to act. If they act now they could be rid of this thing quite quickly. In a month they could have 1000 times more cases.
snippet.textOriginal: I live in China. I'm a little worried about the UK's lax attitude since my family live there. Italy waited a long time to take action and now they are in a bad way. Borris Johnson has basically said he wants to wait until summer to do anything because he doesn't want to add too much strain to the NHS. The UK has about a hundred cases and they are still giving people a choice on how they want to react and not closing the schools, non essential buildings etc. From what I've experienced the action they eventually take will last a much longer time the longer they wait to act. If they act now they could be rid of this thing quite quickly. In a month they could have 1000 times more cases.

snippet.textDisplay: Hey Mike, just curious but with all the disinfecting going on mainly using 70% alcohol to clean our hands and disinfecting, could this potentially cause a spike in bacteria or viruses that will become resistant to alcohol? We're already seeing something similar with antibiotics and bacteria (infact this may also be related as a fair amount of soaps nowadays contains antibacterial chemicals and we'd be using these to wash our hands).
snippet.textOriginal: Hey Mike, just curious but with all the disinfecting going on mainly using 70% alcohol to clean our hands and disinfecting, could this potentially cause a spike in bacteria or viruses that will become resistant to alcohol?
